title: CNN's Going Green explores the innovations protecting and purifying water - PR Newswire
summary: The article explores various green innovations around the world focused on protecting and purifying water, from marine conservation projects to solar-powered desalination solutions and recycling wastewater into reusable non-potable water.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses various innovations aimed at protecting and purifying water, such as marine conservation projects, solar-powered desalination solutions, and recycling wastewater, all contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on environmental innovations related to protecting and purifying water, rather than new or improved products or business processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses innovative products and processes aimed at protecting and purifying water, promoting sustainability through environmentally friendly materials, sustainable production processes, and water conservation.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights green processes such as solar-powered desalination, water recycling systems, and converting agricultural waste into water filtration mediums to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 221310 - Water Supply and Irrigation Systems, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 562910 - Remediation Services
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on genuine innovations and efforts to protect and purify water, showcasing various projects and technologies with positive environmental impacts.

title: Sustainable Shoes: 13 Brands Creating Planet-Friendly Footwear - Pebble Magazine
summary: The article provides information on sustainable shoe brands offering eco-friendly and ethically manufactured footwear using responsibly sourced materials. It highlights various companies and their efforts towards environmentally responsible practices, including using recycled materials, vegan leathers, and supporting sustainable processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 448210 - Shoe Stores, 424340 - Footwear Merchant Wholesalers, 316219 - Other Footwear Manufacturing, 316213 - Men's Footwear (except athletic) Manufacturing

title: New lithium discovery highlights why we never run out of resources - Yield PRO magazine
summary: The article discusses the misconceptions surrounding resource availability and mining of lithium.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article mainly focuses on the availability and mining of lithium resources and does not primarily discuss innovations aimed at reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article primarily focuses on the mining and availability of lithium resources and does not discuss new or improved products or business processes.
green_product: FALSE. The article is centered on the discovery and fears related to the lithium deposits and does not focus on the design, manufacturing, or use of a specific good or service that significantly reduces environmental impact.
green_process: FALSE. The article primarily discusses the availability and scarcity of lithium resources and does not focus on methods or techniques in manufacturing, production, or operational activities that minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 212299 (All Other Metal Ore Mining), 325131 (Inorganic Dye and Pigment Manufacturing), 221119 (Other Electric Power Generation), 213115 (Support Activities for Nonmetallic Minerals (except Fuels) Mining)
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not promote false or misleading environmental benefits about a product or practice; it discusses the misconceptions related to resource availability and predictions.

title: Victoriaâ€™s New Recycling Scheme Is Serving Us Utopian Slay - The Latch
summary: Victoria has launched a Container Deposit Scheme, offering 10-cent refunds for each can, bottle, or carton recycled. The scheme aims to reduce litter, create jobs, and increase recycling rates in the state.
green_innovation: TRUE, The Container Deposit Scheme contributes to environmental sustainability by promoting recycling, reducing litter, and fostering a more sustainable future.
business_innovation: FALSE, The focus of the article is on a recycling scheme and its benefits, rather than on a new or significantly improved product or business process introduced by a firm.
green_product: TRUE, The recycling scheme and incentivizing the return of cans, bottles, and cartons promote reuse, reduce waste, and conserve resources, aligning with the principles of green products.
green_process: FALSE, The article discusses a recycling scheme for containers and increasing recycling rates, which are more focused on waste management and sustainability practices rather than manufacturing or operational processes.
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not contain any deceptive marketing tactics or false environmental claims; it primarily discusses a genuine recycling scheme introduced by Victoria.
